prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Eastern Association of Graduates of the Angle School of Orthodontia Records. Rare Book Room, New York Academy of Medicine Library.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Eastern Association of Graduates of the Angle School of Orthodontia formed on June 11, 1909. Members were students of Dr. Edward H. Angle, an innovator in the field of orthodontics (membership was limited for other individuals). As stated in the Association's constitution, its purpose was "the study of orthodontia, its advancement, and the promulgation of the welfare of the Angle School, and its Alumni Society." After the close of the Angle School and the death of Dr. Angle in 1930, the Association faced a diminishing membership. At 1939 annual meeting, the Association brought its existence to an end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This small collection contains the constitution, by-laws, and minutes of the Society, as well as a meeting program for the thirtieth annual meeting, held May 8-9, 1939.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of The New York Academy of Medicine Library. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

userestrict.p: Requests for permission to quote from or publish any materials should be directed to the curatorial staff of the Rare Book Room in writing.

processinfo.p: Materials which were in a binder are now housed in acid-free file folders.
